original_title: Texas Republicans advance redistricting plan after Democrats return | Fox News
article_summary: Republicans in Texas are moving forward with a new congressional redistricting bill, potentially flipping five Democratic seats to Republican control. The move has sparked a national debate and accusations of gerrymandering, with Democrats in California and New York also pursuing their own redistricting plans. Rep. Roger Williams, R-Texas, defends the Republican approach as adhering to Texas redistricting laws.</s>
